extendedIngredients.name: pancetta
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound thickly sliced pancetta, cut into 1/4 -inch dice
extendedIngredients.originalName: thickly sliced pancetta, cut into 1/4 -inch dice

title: Pan-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Pancetta
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Pan-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Pancettan a try. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 8 and costs $2.1 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 8g of protein, 12g of fat, and a total of 188 calories. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. A mixture of shallots, thickly pancetta, wine vinegar, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 57%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Pan Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Italian Seasoned Pan Roasted Garlic Brussels Sprouts, and Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Pancetta.
instructions: In a large deep skillet, cook the pancetta over moderate heat until it is slightly crisp and the fat is rendered, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in the shallots, season with salt and pepper and cook until golden, about 10 minutes. Add the brussels sprouts and vinegar and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and cook until the sprouts and shallots are tender and the pan is almost dry, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and keep warm until serving.

steps.step: In a large deep skillet, cook the pancetta over moderate heat until it is slightly crisp and the fat is rendered, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in the shallots, season with salt and pepper and cook until golden, about 10 minutes.
Add the brussels sprouts and vinegar and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and cook until the sprouts and shallots are tender and the pan is almost dry, 10 to 12 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and keep warm until serving.
